name: pungently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that smells or tastes very strong, sometimes unpleasantly: A whiff of newly ground espresso wafted pungently from the café. The whisky is made entirely with the distillery's own pungently peated malt.
literary in a way that has a strong effect: It is a pungently written narrative. He talks interestingly and pungently about a pressing subject. See
pungent
More examplesFewer examplesThe Passaic River still pungently flows alongside abandoned factories.The room was filled with the pungently scented flowers.The natural world is keenly observed and pungently described in this beautifully written piece.Some of the letters were pungently expressive.
